title: Cardano in South L.A.
description: The population of Catalyst lacks diversity and thus is in danger of adopting a dominant world view that oppresses underrepresented folks.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement I find very valid and the connection to diversity and the idea of Cardano to change the world but Catalyst does not display diversity as a community should be a focus. The solution that the proposer is offering is effectively addressing the challenge in that he is able to name the group that the hub is dedicated to and the content that the hub is going to deliver to the participants and members that would join the hub. By choosing a University, the proposal might be able to onboard new users into the ecosystem, bring a University on board, onboard developers into the ecosystem and provide relevant information on Cardano to a new community.
f6_assessments.q1: Relevant experience is given, Matthias is a very active member of the Catalyst community and would be able to deliver the overall message and value to a hub. Being a graduate of the University can be seen as a great start for the networking event and will give credibility to the program. The financial budget is very humble and if documented, this hub could be used as a template to other Universities. It is an easy way to scale-up and reach new members, drive adoption from the ground level, empower and make people curious.
f6_assessments.q2: Audatibility is given and content of the proposed workshop is provided. Education as the key metric to onboard new members is a good way. Outreach ideas are great - start at the University that you graduated at and might still have connections to, give out rewards for people to sign up early to enhance planning and make the workshop more attractive. This can be seen as measurements to prevent the risk that the hub is not being noticed much. Overall, I think this is a simple and great solution to introduce a community to Cardano and onboard new people and guide access to what it´s all about without being overly patronizing.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seek to increase the awareness of cardano blockchain to under represented folk which in turn will increase the adoption of cardano. The Proposal is very specific - targeting a particular university community , The Proposal fit into the challenge  and the budget breakdown incentivise the students with GiftCard which i really like.
f6_assessments.q1: The two proposers has better understanding of the target group in the university since both of them are graduates of the same school, Secondly one of them has been active in the cardano community and have Technical Skills to answer questions during the events. There is a clear timeline for the event which is good.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal lack clear KPI , there is no where it mention the definition of success, though there is no specific event date but There is plan to host two virtual events during the Fall 2021 semester for CSUDH , based on the information provided i score 3

solution: Host information events aimed at students and faculty at CSUDH, a traditionally latinx and black University in Carson, California.
experience: Both proposers are graduates of CSUDH. Azbai advocates for equity to resources, Matthias is a dedicated Catalyst community member.
